bioconda.name: treemix
bioconda.summary: TreeMix is a method for inferring the patterns of population splits and mixtures in the history of a set of populations.

biocontainers.name: treemix
biocontainers.summary: Treemix is a method for inferring the patterns of  population splits and mixtures in the history of a set of populations

biotools.summary: Method for inferring the patterns of population splits and mixtures in the history of a set of populations. In the underlying model, the modern-day populations in a species are related to a common ancestor via a graph of ancestral populations. The allele frequencies in the modern populations are used to infer the structure of this graph.

bioschemas.name: TreeMix
bioschemas.summary: Method for inferring the patterns of population splits and mixtures in the history of a set of populations. In the underlying model, the modern-day populations in a species are related to a common ancestor via a graph of ancestral populations. The allele frequencies in the modern populations are used to infer the structure of this graph.
